docs.abstract: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan squared off on Thursday night in Danville, Ky., in the only vice presidential debate.
docs.snippet: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan squared off on Thursday night in Danville, Ky., in the only vice presidential debate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tassafaronga Village, a mixed-income development in Oakland, Calif., and the Richardson Apartments for the formerly homeless in San Francisco have created ripples of change in their communities.

headline.seo: Tassafaronga Village and Richardson Apartments in Bay Area
headline.main: Design as Balm for a Community’s Soul
headline.print_headline: Design as Balm for a Community’s Soul

docs.abstract: Michael Kimmelman describes positive impact of architect David Baker's building projects for the poor and disenfranchised in the San Francisco Bay area; notes that the Tassafaronga Village, a mixed-income development in Oakland, Calif, and the Richardson Apartments for the formerly homeless in San Francisco have created ripples of change in their communities.
docs.snippet: Tassafaronga Village, a mixed-income development in Oakland, Calif., and the Richardson Apartments for the formerly homeless in San Francisco have created ripples of change in their communities.

docs.lead_paragraph: Drugs that are normally used to increase focus are in some cases being prescribed simply to improve struggling, low-income students’ academic performance at school.

headline.seo: Attention Disorder or Not, Children Prescribed Pills to Help in School
headline.main: Attention Disorder or Not, Pills to Help in School
headline.print_headline: Attention Disorder or Not, Pills to Help in School

docs.abstract: Some doctors are prescribing stimulants to low-income children who are struggling in elementary schools, not to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder but to boost academic performance; pediatrician Michael Anderson is a proponent of the idea, saying medication is the most reliable and pragmatic way for families that cannot afford behavior-based therapies to redirect the student toward success.
docs.snippet: Drugs that are normally used to increase focus are in some cases being prescribed simply to improve struggling, low-income students’ academic performance at school.
